N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6655.2 - OAA matching requirements

State Regulations
(a) Of the amounts allocated to area
agencies, the office permits no more than 8.5 percent of the sum of the Federal
OAA supportive and nutrition services allotments to be used to reimburse area
agencies for up to 75 percent of the approved costs for administering the OAA
portion of area plans. (b) The
office reimburses area agencies for up to 90 percent of the approved costs for
supportive and nutrition services up to their OAA allotments. None of these OAA
services funds may be used for program development and coordination, except
that program development for the elderly poor is part of senior opportunities
and services, which is an allowable service. (c) Area agencies' non-Federal share of
approved expenditures may be met through county (or City of New York) funds
appropriated for OAA services, other public and private funds (except for funds
used to match other State or Federal noncompetitive funds), in-kind
contributions (such as salaries and fringe benefits of personnel assigned to
OAA services, including prorated salaries for personnel assigned part-time, the
fair market rental value of donated space, and building maintenance) for direct
program costs for which an audit trail is maintained, or participant
contributions, but may not be met through proceeds of required cost-sharing
under EISEP or CSE. Notes
